direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods add HTML content to the element but at different positions (end vs. start).
Both methods add content to the element, but appendElement adds a new element, while append adds HTML content.
Both methods add content to the element, but prependElement adds a new element at the start, while append adds HTML content at the end.
Both methods add content to the element, but appendText adds a text node, while append adds HTML content.
Both methods add content to the element, but prependText adds a text node at the start, while append adds HTML content at the end.
Both methods manipulate the element's content structure, but wrap surrounds the element with HTML content, while append adds content inside the element.
Both methods set the inner HTML of the element, but html replaces existing content, while append adds to it.
Both methods handle the element's content, but empty removes all content, while append adds new content.
Both methods manipulate the element's child nodes, but insertChildren adds children at a specific index, while append adds content at the end.
Both methods add a node to the element, but appendChild adds a specific node, while append adds HTML content.
